org.docgene.scripts

Class DocJScriptContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.scripthelper.context.DefaultScriptContext
      • org.docgene.scripts.DocJScriptContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.scripthelper.context.ScriptContext

    public class DocJScriptContext
extends org.scripthelper.context.DefaultScriptContext
    Represents the context which is accessible natively for all scripts through the context object. Many methods of this context are only a xrapper around the underlying HookContext.

      • getElementIndex

        public int getElementIndex()
        Return the index of the currently handled element in the wiki source tree. Note that this index does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Returns:
        the index

      • hasPreviousElement

        public boolean hasPreviousElement()
        Return true if there is a previous element before the current element. Note that this does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Returns:
        true if there is a previous element before the current element

      • hasNextElement

        public boolean hasNextElement()
        Return true if there is a next element after the current element. Note that this does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Returns:
        true if there is a next element after the current element

      • getPreviousElement

        public ParagraphElement getPreviousElement()
        Return the previous element before the current element. Note that this does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Returns:
        the previous element before the current element

      • getNextElement

        public ParagraphElement getNextElement()
        Return the next element after the current element.
        Returns:
        the next element after the current element

      • getElementsAfter

        public java.util.List<ParagraphElement> getElementsAfter()
        Return all the elements after the current element. Note that this list is a copy of the actual list, so changing it will not change the effective list of elements. Use insertElementsAfter(org.docgene.model.ParagraphElement...) if you want to add new elements. This does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Returns:
        all the elements after the current element

      • getElementsBefore

        public java.util.List<ParagraphElement> getElementsBefore()
        Return all the elements before the current element. Note that this list is a copy of the actual list, so changing it will not change the effective list of elements. This does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Returns:
        all the elements before the current element

      • getSiblingElement

        public ParagraphElement getSiblingElement(int elementOffset)
        Return a sibling element with an offset relative to the current element. This does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Parameters:
        elementOffset - the offset
        Returns:
        the sibling element

      • getSiblingElementTypeDecl

        public java.lang.String getSiblingElementTypeDecl(int elementOffset)
        Return the type declaration of the sibling element with an offset relative to the current element. It will return "none" if the element is null or has no type declaration. This does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Parameters:
        elementOffset - the offset
        Returns:
        the sibling element type declaration

      • removeCurrentElement

        public void removeCurrentElement()
        Remove the current element.

      • insertElementsBefore

        public void insertElementsBefore(ParagraphElement... elements)
        Insert a list of elements before the current element. This does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Parameters:
        elements - the list of elements

      • insertElementsAfter

        public void insertElementsAfter(ParagraphElement... elements)
        Insert a list of elements after the current element. This does not take into account modifications added by the script.
        Parameters:
        elements - the list of elements
